definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: You can talk him into the project we are handling at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 你可以劝他加入到我们这会儿正在做的项目。

sentences.english: Now Lin is helping Jack with the packing.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿小林正帮着杰克收拾行装。

sentences.english: At the moment I'm a little overwhelmed.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿我真是有点目不暇接了。

sentences.english: For the moment, she could scarcely forgive the substitution.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿，她没法子宽恕这种更替。

sentences.english: He’s at school right now. The Technological University of Panama.
sentences.chinese: 他这会儿在学校，巴拿马科技大学。

sentences.english: He had been growing nettled before, but now he pulled himself together.
sentences.chinese: 他本来有些冒火，但这会儿他又恢复了常态。

sentences.english: But she did not seem to be using it now. She was fighting with her stone knife.
sentences.chinese: 但这会儿她似乎没使魔杖，她是用石刀在打仗。

sentences.english: They were putting up the shutters.
sentences.chinese: 他们这会儿正在拉下百叶窗。

sentences.english: I was astonished when hearing these words and realized the Bodhisattva in my dream was Manjusri indeed.
sentences.chinese: 我这会儿才大吃一惊，原来那梦里真是文殊菩萨。

sentences.english: It's a shame and I am ashamed for my own country!
sentences.chinese: 真是无耻呀，我这会儿还为我的国家感到没脸见人。

sentences.english: Uh, do you know what's happening right now?
sentences.chinese: 呃，你知道这会儿发生了什么事儿吧？

sentences.english: The line's busy at the moment.
She's right now at the Flame Mountain.
I don't feel like a walk just now.
You'd better not to go into his office to spite him now.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿，你最好别进他办公室打扰他。
